headline: Apple engineers designed a custom face mask for employees â€” take a look
summary: Apple has designed a reusable, disposable face mask for employees to wear during the pandemic. The face masks look like a typical Apple product, with a minimalist design and  packaging. Apple told Bloomberg that the company researched and tested effective materials that wouldn't put further strain on the supply chain for personal protective equipment.
The CDC issued guidance encouraging Americans to shop online rather than in crowded stores during the holiday season because of the pandemic.
headline: As holidays approach, CDC puts shopping at crowded stores on Black Friday in high-risk category
Virgin Galactic jumps over 20% as Street continues to recommend the space tourism company
summary: Shares of Virgin Galactic surged as much as 22% in trading Monday after Wall Street firms continued set higher expectations
The stock market is likely to see strong gains next year due to increased liquidity and an improvement in the coronavirus, the finance professor told CNBC on Monday.
headline: Wharton's Jeremy Siegel: Wall Street could boom in 2021 'no matter who is president'

summary: With the death of Ruth Bader Ginsburg, President Donald Trump announced Amy Coney Barrett as a new nominee to the Supreme Court, which could have a major effect on American's health-care options, particularly for those worried about getting health insurance with a preexisting condition.
headline: Could Covid-19 be considered a preexisting condition? It's complicated.
The U.S. is 'not in a good place' as daily coronavirus cases grow beyond 40,000, Fauci says
summary: "There are states that are starting to show an uptick in cases and even some increase in hospitalizations in some states," Dr. Anthony Fauci said on Monday.
"Every Republican agrees we're going to protect preexisting conditions," Sen. Ted Cruz of Texas told CNBC on Monday.
headline: Sen. Ted Cruz: GOP will protect Americans with preexisting conditions if Obamacare struck down

summary: Would you like to know where you can find the next trillion dollar growth stock? If so, ERShares may have an answer for you. It's an ETF with NYSE Ticker: ENTR. This ETF invests in the leading Entrepreneurial publicly listed companies around the world.

headline: Trump vs Biden: Here are the health-care stocks that could benefit from the 2020 election
summary: Health care is again at a political crossroads heading into the U.S. presidential election. Gina Sanchez of Chantico Global and Craig Johnson of Piper Sandler discuss the potential winners and losers in the space.

headline: Goldman's Consumer Bank Chief to Give Up Post in Leadership Swap
Health and safety certificates may be the new 'visas' that permit air travel, Etihad CEO says
summary: Airlines will need to meet a "harmonized" standard of health measures as air travel returns, according to Tony Douglas of Etihad Airways.

headline: Uber wins legal fight to regain London license
summary: A judge overturned a ban on the ride-hailing app by the city's transport regulator.
Signs of a worsening pandemic continue to keep investors on edge.
headline: Treasury yields higher as investors monitor coronavirus, political developments

summary: The U.S. government has reportedly imposed restrictions on exports to SMIC, China's biggest chip manufacturer, a move that threatens Beijing's push to become more self-reliant in one of the most critical areas of technology.
headline: U.S. sanctions on chipmaker SMIC hit at the very heart of China's tech ambitions
Amazon Prime Day set for October 13 and 14 after coronavirus delayed original summer date
summary: Amazon postponed its biggest shopping day of the year after the pandemic created unprecedented strain on its warehouses.
Shares of Big Hit Entertainment, the music label behind global K-pop phenomenon BTS, were priced on Monday at the top end of the range ahead of its highly-anticipated market debut.
headline: South Korea entertainment shares surge as K-pop sensation BTS' label prices IPO at top end of range
Judge blocks Trump administration's ban on new TikTok downloads from US app stores
summary: A U.S. judge has blocked an order from the Trump administration that would have banned TikTok from being downloaded from U.S. app stores.

headline: Stock futures rise slightly in overnight trading following a 4-week losing streak
summary: The S&P 500 and the 30-stock Dow were coming off their fourth straight negative week.

headline: It's too risky to put new money in stocks right now, Wells Fargo's Chris Harvey warns
summary: Wells Fargo Securities Christopher Harvey believes the uptick in coronavirus cases paired with election uncertainty could spark another 10% market drop.

headline: Supreme Court confirmation hearings to start in two weeks, Sen. Lindsey Graham says
summary: Trump's nomination has seized attention in an already intense election cycle dominated by the coronavirus pandemic and the ensuing economic collapse.
